alert.note: Alert for Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 2:38PM CDT until July 10 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River at El Reno affecting Canadian County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River at El Reno. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, The river remains within its banks in Canadian County... from near El Reno to areas upstream of Yukon. Very low-lying fields and private roads near the river could be briefly isolated by flows in cutoff channels crossing the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 14.1 feet this evening. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM CDT.
